intro: Draba pickeringii, commonly known as Pickering's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Draba pickeringii is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
